issue.title: DOC Clarify README intro

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
Right now, we don't really say what a wavelet scattering transform is. One sentence describing it would be good.

Also, it would be good to have some sort of picture. This could be a general schematic of the scattering transform, or maybe pictures of wavelets in 1D, 2D, and 3D?

body:
Yes, a figure would be great. I would prefer a schema of the scattering transform rather than simply pictures of wavelets, because Kymatio is more than a library for wavelet transforms.

This is the one I've been using for many years to describe 1-D scattering. I think Stéphane uses it too now.
If it weren't for the awful jet colormap ... and the Greek letters "gamma", "gamma-2" ... it would do the job.

[temporal_scattering_flowchart.pdf](https://github.com/kymatio/kymatio/files/2756834/temporal_scattering_flowchart.pdf)

I like this one, and I think we ultimately want to go with something like this, but:

1) `jet` is awful, as you say,
2) it uses different notation, as you also say,
3) it's a little busy and needs to be cleaned up, and,
4) most importantly, it's for 1D.

I'm as much of a 1D partisan as the next guy, but the (unfortunate) fact is that most people who use scattering use it for 2D. Those people will be misled, if not confused, if the first thing they see is a bunch of waveforms. It may be more illustrative to do images for the front page.
Hey. This is a great image. I think displaying 2D wavelet transforms would be confusing as well. @janden @lostanlen let's include this somewhere? Need first to reduce the size of this pdf!

@edouardoyallon So you want to stick with 1D? Ok. I still think we would need to remake the figure with the correct notation, etc. That way, we can also make sure that things are properly rasterized and avoid the huge size.

> @edouardoyallon So you want to stick with 1D? Ok. I still think we would need to remake the figure with the correct notation, etc. That way, we can also make sure that things are properly rasterized and avoid the huge size.

Sounds good!
@janden maybe it's a good idea to generate this figure now?

issue.title: Documentation is outdated

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
We should revise the whole documentation as well as examples.

- [x] `make html` is currently broken.
- [x] Examples run with the new backend.
- [ ] Documentation is consistent with the code.
- [ ] No links or references are broken.
- [ ] Automatic deployment on the website from the code (see #350).
- [x] Guideline for installing works.
- [ ] Use of \math everywhere.
- [ ] Improved illustrations (see #286).
- [x] Specific discussions about each environment that we provide (numpy, torch, etc.).
- [x] Sphinx flags are updated (given the new sphinx version).
- [x] New benchmarks.
- [x] Including examples (when modified) in the test suite (see #362).
- [x] Update dependencies in `pip`, and `README.md`.
